snippet: A study has found that even for people who are not ready to stop smoking immediately, medicine taken over time can improve their chances of eventually quitting.
abstract: Study in Journal of the American Medical Assn finds that medication designed to help patients quit smoking, typically administered when patient feels they are ready to quit, can be effective even for those who feel they are not ready, opening door for eventual cessation.
lead_paragraph: A study has found that even for people who are not ready to stop smoking immediately, medicine taken over time can improve their chances of eventually quitting.

headline.main: Medicine Given Even Before Smokers Are Ready to Quit Is Found to Help Them
